title: Adaptive Fine-Tuning Strategies for Large Language Models in Low-Resource Domains
abstract: We present a novel approach to efficiently adapt large language models to specialized domains with limited training data, achieving state-of-the-art results while requiring significantly fewer compute resources.

title: Bridging Vision and Language: A Survey of Multimodal Learning Approaches
abstract: A comprehensive survey of multimodal learning approaches that combine visual and textual information, covering architectures, training strategies, and evaluation methodologies.

title: Safe Exploration in Reinforcement Learning with Natural Language Constraints
abstract: We propose a method for incorporating natural language safety constraints into reinforcement learning, enabling safer exploration in complex environments.

title: Fairness-Aware Training for Multilingual Language Models
abstract: We introduce a training framework that improves fairness across languages in multilingual models, reducing performance disparities between high- and low-resource languages.

title: Visual Grounding with Contextual Attention for Embodied Agents
abstract: A contextual attention mechanism that enables embodied agents to ground natural language instructions in visual observations, improving task completion rates in simulated environments.
